title: display pairing for Berkeley Oldstyle?
content: Designing an earth science book for grades 6-8. Berkeley Oldstyle for text is a must, as is Metaplus bold for captions and sidebars. What I can play with are the chapter heads and drop caps. Suggestions are more than welcome.
author: quiddity

comments.content: I hope someone else is editing this textbook. You spelled _Berkeley_ two different ways, both of them missing an **e**.
Sorry. Too many long days and late nights. I picked up the name from the style guide they provided to me--I should have double-checked it before posting.

I'd use just use [LTC Californian](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201123542/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-californian/) or [Californian FB](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201123542/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-californian/); two more "authentic" cuts of Berkeley.

Berkeley Oldstyle is a pretty good display face.  
It was used a lot in the 1980s for that, set tight.
Thank you all for your recommendations. They'll definitely be helpful in steering me in the right direction.
